meanings.definition: Not of or relating to history.
meanings.sent1: The story was purely nonhistorical, focusing on imaginary lands and creatures.
meanings.sent2: The book contained a nonhistorical account of a magical kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The nonhistorical tale of talking animals brought laughter to the children.
meanings.sent4: Her nonhistorical explanation for the mysterious events was like a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The nonhistorical events in the story made it feel like a dream.

meanings.definition: Not based on or concerned with history.
meanings.sent1: The movie presented a nonhistorical version of the famous battle.
meanings.sent2: The painting depicted a nonhistorical scene of futuristic cities.
meanings.sent3: His nonhistorical interpretation of the past events raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The nonhistorical approach to the documentary was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The nonhistorical facts in the report seemed out of place.

meanings.definition: Not occurring or existing in history.
meanings.sent1: The discovery of the nonhistorical artifact puzzled the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: Legends often contain nonhistorical elements that captivate the audience.
meanings.sent3: The nonhistorical relic found in the cave sparked curiosity.
meanings.sent4: The nonhistorical ruins in the forest seemed out of place.
meanings.sent5: The nonhistorical figure in the painting seemed to come to life.
